meanings.definition: To refuse to accept or allow something
meanings.sent1: She decided to reeject the offer to join the club.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to reeject the late homework submission.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reeject the idea of eating ice cream for dinner, but his stomach disagreed.
meanings.sent4: The old computer started to reeject any new software updates.
meanings.sent5: The bouncer had to reeject the underage individual from entering the club.

meanings.sent1: The machine reejected the coin because it was counterfeit.
meanings.sent2: The volcano reejected hot lava during the eruption.
meanings.sent3: The cat reejected the unwanted visitor by hissing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The pressure built up in the bottle caused it to reeject the cork with a pop.
meanings.sent5: The sneeze reejected the dust particles from his nose.

meanings.definition: To dismiss or discard as unacceptable
meanings.sent1: The editor had to reeject the poorly written article.
meanings.sent2: The judge had to reeject the evidence due to lack of authenticity.
meanings.sent3: She had to reeject the burnt toast and make a fresh batch.
meanings.sent4: The committee decided to reeject the proposal after much deliberation.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to reeject the defective products before they reached the customers.
